Translate a RNA sequence to a protein sequence

Source: R/translate.R
translate.Rd

Translate a nucleotide (RNA) sequence to a protein chain according to the standard genetic code

translate(
  mrna,
  transl_table = 1,
  start_codon = "AUG",
  start_codon_first = TRUE,
  no_stop = FALSE,
  type = "olc",
  sep = ""
)

Arguments

mrna

The messenger RNA.
transl_table

The translation table used. Defaults to 1 (standard genetic code). See more at aminoacid()
start_codon

The start codon. Defaults to "AUG".
start_codon_first

Start the translation with the start_codon? defaults to TRUE. In this case, all bases before the start_codon will be ignored.
no_stop

A logical indicating if the translation shouldn't stop when a stop codon is encountered. Defaults to FALSE. If TRUE, translation will continue up to the end of the chain, and stop codons will be represented by "*".
type

The type of output. One of

  • "olc" for one-letter code, e.g., "V" (default).

  • "tlc" for three-letter code, e.g., "Val".

  • "name" for the complete name, e.g., "Valine".
sep

The separator between amino acids. Defaults to "-".

Value

A character

Examples

code <- rand_nuc_seq(25, type = "rna")
#> Start codon  : 1-3
#> Stop codon   : UAG
#> Position stop: 22-24
translate(code)
#> [1] "MLCHASK*"
